jobs_description: Who are we? Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company®, operating over 250 data centers across the globe. Digital leaders harness Equinix's trusted platform to bring together and interconnect foundational infrastructure at software speed. Equinix enables organizations to access all the right places, partners and possibilities to scale with agility, speed the launch of digital services, deliver world-class experiences and multiply their value, while supporting their sustainability goals. A career at Equinix means you will collaborate on work that impacts the world and be surrounded by endless opportunities to learn new skills and grow in varied directions. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success. Customer Success Analyst Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company, operating 250 data centers across the globe and providing interconnections to all the key clouds and networks. Businesses need one place to simplify and bring together fragmented, complex infrastructure that spans private and public cloud environments. Our global platform allows customers to place infrastructure wherever they need it and connect it to everything they need to succeed. We are a fast-growing global company with 20+ years of continuous growth. Through our innovative portfolio of high-performance products and services, we have created the largest, most active global ecosystem of 10,000+ companies, including 2,000+ networks and 3,000+ cloud and IT service providers in 32 countries spanning six continents. A career at Equinix means you will collaborate on work that impacts the world and be surrounded by endless opportunities to learn new skills and grow in varied directions. We accept diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success. Our customer success team is responsible for managing and supervising all services and demands in search of the customer's happiness and retention and guarantee customer experience. What You’ll Be Doing Utilizes onboarding templates and checklists and uses judgment to make modifications to the standard during onboarding based on customers needs and project scope Uses the 3 Phase Methodology for onboarding: Phase 1 - Conducts pre-onboarding for key customers Phase 2 - Kick-off Onboarding: Sets up, facilitates and conducts kick-off meetings for customers Phase 3 - Continuous Follow-up: follows up with key customers Communicates optimally, able to translate internal processes to be able to set customer expectations. Communicates with developed skills in a way that allows the CSM to influence the customer and others. Able to connect with customers what other teams at Equinix do and how customers should apply them Collects in depth information so that the experience is personalized Proficient in Equinix's processes, policies and customer concern paths Post onboarding, follows up on actions and tasks and understands how these tasks connect to customer's goals Ability to articulate trends for this customer Able to utilize moderate inquiry (questioning) skills with the customer to better understand their business. Able to use prior information to inquire more deeply about the customer Develop, maintain and supervise progress of a Customer Success Plan Drive product and process adoption by understanding customer usage trends of key customers Able to articulate a moderate understanding of Equinix's products (current and future) and provide customer education. Collect customer feedback, providing it to relevant teams to improve the customer experience Proactively identifies feedback trends across customers and drives process improvements for key accounts Proactively review product utilization and propose potential solutions for customers Partners with account team for presale discussion to facilitate account growth and gain insight and understanding of the customer Acts as a customer advocate Ensure smooth and clear handoff to/from internal teams Proactively contacts key customers to conduct pulse check (i.e. heath check) Accumulate, utilize and distribute standard methodologies Participate in customer projects, may lead cross functional teams for key customer projects Assess issue to validate, prioritize and progress accordingly Handle, document and raise visibility of critical issues as appropriate Engage key partners as needed to ensure adherence to standard operating procedures, policies/rules/restrictions and when resolving issues and presenting externally with support from management Identifies process improvement opportunities or plans while using what is already in place Participate in and/or collects issue post mortem/root cause analysis, to communicate resolution and any improvement plans when required Main point of contact for the customer providing transparent and empathetic support, for CSM issues. Raises to GEM and functional teams as agreed Work cross functionally to proactively engage internal colleagues in order to provide ongoing, timely updates and resolutions to the customer Provides globally consistent communication Involved in managing accounts in conjunction with sales, including support of order fulfillment and other contractual obligations Flags churn risks as they become known and proactively engages with sales and management to raise awareness of potential churn Leads delivery of regular Operational Survey Review for selected accounts Supports resolution of actions from CBRs and handles follow-up actions from OBRs Drives high customer happiness What We’ll Expect From You Advanced English required Previous Experience in customer service or customer experience What Will Be The Difference If You Have Experience in IT / Data Center industry Basic technical skills Bachelor's degree Why Equinix The opportunity to be part of the digital transformation in the world in a company that was elected by the employees as the best places to work by Glassdoor and it´s is GPTW for several consecutive years. “Equinix is an equal employment opportunity employer. titulo: Exclusive PWD - IBM Brazil Internship Program - Associates
jobs_description: 689675BR Introduction At IBM, our work is more than a job, it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think together with our customers and sell. Create markets. Invent. To collaborate. Not only to do things in a better way, but to reach for the impossible. Are you passionate about being at the forefront of the new era in technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, Blue Journey, IBM's internship program, is the place for you. Blue Journey aims to promote the professional development of students through practical experiences, contact with a global community of more than 6000 interns and free learning tools, offering a workplace experience that promotes diversity and inclusion, to gain new skills and become qualified, differentiated professionals who are essential for society. Be part of a real company project, train and develop in a global company. If you are currently studying a STEM career, you have a passion for technology and innovation and you meet the requirements APPLY NOW! Your Role and Responsibilities Affirmative Position For People With Disabilities. Unleash your potential - for our clients and your career Joining IBM Services as an Associate offers you an opportunity to work on client teams, using technologies to help business transform the way they work. As an Associate, you'll develop relevant skills and quickly gain meaningful experience. Your network of experts and mentors will provide career coaching and experience with leading technology, while you solve clients' most challenging problems with future-defining solutions. Consultant You are a great thinker - and you are passionate about making change. Develop these great ideas for customer and help define how companies interact with the world. Combine your expertise and your business and technical interests to help transform global companies. Data Scientist You understand that a business strategy is data driven. After all, a cognitive business is a thinking business. Analyze data and forecast trends to make relevant recommendations to customers, using cognitive tools to research and analyze data. Designer By providing guidance, you are building on your experience. Understanding the user is an art (combined with a lot of research), and you never tire of making interactions. As an Associate Designer for IBM customers, you will focus on customer needs and creating world-class digital experiences. Developer When you create and perform interactions, you solve problems, whether it's just fixing a bug or creating an application that changes the way how we live. Take on variety of activities: high-performance design, development and maintenance, and scalability of databases and server applications. Technical Specialist You are not scared of complex scenarios. You are innovative and want to make a difference using technology. Join us as an Expert Associate Technician to gain specialized skills in technology products or industry solutions that will enable you to design, create and build the infrastructure our customers need to reinvent their business. Todas as vagas são elegíveis para pessoas com deficiência ou reabilitadas. Discover more: ibm.com/associates Required Technical and Professional Expertise Be an advanced student of a technical/college career such as: Engineering (Computing, Control and Automation, Electrical, Industrial, Mechatronics, Civil, Materials, Production, Telecommunications, Mechanical, Metallurgical, Physics), Computer Science, Information Systems, Computer Electronics and Telecommunications, Programming and System Analysis, Security, Database Technology, Software Development, Math and Statistics, Network Administration, Web Development, Big Data or Artificial Intelligence. Be a regular student. Availability to work 6 hours daily: from 9am to 3pm. Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise Intermediate English. We're looking for passionate, original thinkers who want to drive progress, grow their network and further their careers. If you see yourself as someone who never stops learning, who believes no problem is too big to solve, and who wants to unleash your potential, IBM services is for you. About Business Unit IBM Consulting is IBM’s consulting and global professional services business, with market leading capabilities in business and technology transformation. With deep expertise in many industries, we offer strategy, experience, technology, and operations services to many of the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Our people are focused on accelerating our clients’ businesses through the power of collaboration. We believe in the power of technology responsibly used to help people, partners and the planet. Your Life @ IBM In a world where technology never stands still, we understand that, dedication to our clients success, innovation that matters, and trust and personal responsibility in all our relationships, lives in what we do as IBMers as we strive to be the catalyst that makes the world work better. Being an IBMer means you’ll be able to learn and develop yourself and your career, you’ll be encouraged to be courageous and experiment everyday, all whilst having continuous trust and support in an environment where everyone can thrive whatever their personal or professional background. Our IBMers are growth minded, always staying curious, open to feedback and learning new information and skills to constantly transform themselves and our company. They are trusted to provide on-going feedback to help other IBMers grow, as well as collaborate with colleagues keeping in mind a team focused approach to include different perspectives to drive exceptional outcomes for our customers. The courage our IBMers have to make critical decisions everyday is essential to IBM becoming the catalyst for progress, always embracing challenges with resources they have to hand, a can-do attitude and always striving for an outcome focused approach within everything that they do. Are you ready to be an IBMer? About IBM IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business. At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world. Location Statement For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application. Being You @ IBM IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, caste, genetics, pregnancy, disability, neurodivergence, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Location: Curitiba, Parana Company: Wiley (CLT Position) Our mission is to unlock human potential. We welcome you for who you are, and the background you bring, and we embrace individuals who get excited about learning. Bring your experiences, your perspectives, and your passion; it’s in our differences that we empower the way the world learns. About the Role: This position within the Wiley Data Analytics & Insights team, is responsible for functioning as the Data Engineer, to develop and maintain data pipelines from multiple data sources into our Data Lake environment. This individual will work very closely with the other development leads, data engineers, and data architects to build and maintain data pipelines going to different zones of the Snowflake Data Warehouse environment. Determine the optimal approach for extracting, transforming, and loading data into different zones of Data Lake (Raw/Native, Processed/Transformed, Enriched, Archive). This includes design and development to prepare data for movement storage & consumption Views, ELT Processes, Extracts & other processes that manipulate, aggregate, clean, or enrich the data. The individual should demonstrate a thorough understanding of business validations and data quality. They should apply these principles diligently within our processes, aligning with the specific use cases. This data lake would see regular addition of datasets from internal and external sources deemed important for Wiley’s data analytics and insights requirements. In some cases, this role may involve building repeatable data feeds to and from platforms such as, Salesforce, SAP, MDM, Eloqua, e-commerce websites, etc. The position requires development skills to enable the matching and linking of internal and external data sources (especially as it relates to Customer and products) using analytical techniques/tools. The role will have frequent interaction/collaboration with Solutions Architects, Data Architects, BI & Analytics Development, Data Engineering, Marketing, Sales, Application/Product teams and Enterprise Architects to support Wiley’s Data Analytics and Insights roadmap. How you will make an impact: Design and implement secure data pipelines into a Snowflake data warehouse from on-premise and cloud data sources Define best practices and standards for data pipelining and integration with Snowflake data lake and warehouses in collaboration with Data Architect and other Data leads Design and implement high-performing data pipelines feeding downstream systems Collaborate with onshore/ offshore data engineers, BA, and Scrum Masters who will be building or testing data applications in Snowflake environment. Design and implement high-performing BI dashboard integrations Cognos and QlikView working with reporting and data visualization developers Ensure enterprise security and access control policies are adhered to in the solution Creation of architecture and design artifacts and documents Conduct design and code reviews What we look for: B.S Computer Science or related degree 4+ years experience in data pipeline architecture and data modelling Demonstrably deep understanding of SQL and relational databases (Snowflake preferred) Experience with Snowflake SnowSQL and writing user-defined functions would be a plus Hands-on experience with Python, Scala, Java, SQL, and tools like NIFI, Attunity, Spark (Databricks/Qubole), etc. Hands-on experience with data pipeline tools within cloud-based environments (Argo, Airflow, Luigi, DBT) Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools and practices (CircleCI, Travis, Jenkins) Hands-on experience with AWS (SQS, S3, Kinesys, Firehose, MKS, Lambda) Experience with open-source data warehouse tools Constantly improve product quality, security, and performance Write good code, performant code (Python preferred) About Wiley: Wiley is a trusted leader in research and learning, our pioneering solutions and services are paving the way for knowledge seekers as they work to solve the world’s most important challenges. We are advocates of advancement, empowering knowledge-seekers to transform today’s biggest obstacles into tomorrow’s brightest opportunities. With over 200 years of experience in publishing, we continue to evolve knowledge seekers’ steps into strides, illuminating their path forward to personal, educational, and professional success at every stage. Around the globe, we break down barriers for innovators, empowering them to advance discoveries in their fields, adapt their workforces, and shape minds. When applying, please attach your resume/CV to be considered

titulo: Analista Sr. de Inteligência de Mercado - Políticas de Crédito
jobs_description: Sobre a vaga Estamos em busca de um Analista Sênior de Analytics com expertise em políticas de crédito para se juntar à nossa equipe e liderar iniciativas estratégicas que auxiliem todo o mercado apoiando na tomada de decisão em todas as etapas do ciclo de crédito. Este papel é fundamental para entender as necessidades, dores e preocupações dos nossos clientes, traduzindo-as em insights que não apenas otimizem políticas de crédito, mas também impulsionam a excelência na tomada de decisão em todo o ciclo de crédito. Funções que serão desempenhadas: Conduzir estudos estratégicos para identificar as dores dos clientes em relação ao ciclo de crédito e oportunidades de melhoria. Utilizar soluções analíticas avançadas para analisar dados e gerar insights valiosos que aprimorem políticas de crédito e estratégias de gerenciamento de risco. Fornecer liderança técnica e estratégica em análise de dados, atuando como uma referência para o time, na exploração detalhada das fontes de dados, modelos e soluções analíticas pertinentes na decisão do cliente. Desenvolver e executar estratégias que impulsionam a venda de soluções analíticas demonstrando aos nossos clientes a eficiência e a eficácia da tomada de decisão no ciclo de crédito, desde a avaliação do risco até a gestão de cobranças. Colaborar com as equipes internas, incluindo data Science, plataformas, força de vendas e operações. Ser um líder visionário tanto interna quanto externamente, promovendo o uso eficaz e inovador de dados para obter vantagem competitiva em políticas de crédito. Experiências necessárias: Experiência comprovada em análise de dados de produtos de crédito, gerenciamento de dados e ciência de dados, com foco específico em políticas de crédito e gerenciamento de risco. Capacidade de identificar e entender as necessidades dos clientes em relação ao ciclo de crédito e traduzi-las em insights. Fortes habilidades técnicas em análise de dados, estatística e ferramentas de visualização, especialmente aplicadas ao contexto de crédito. Habilidades de comunicação e capacidade de articular insights complexos de forma clara e convincente. Formação em áreas relacionadas, como Estatística, Ciência de Dados, Matemática, Engenharia ou equivalente. Linguagem de programação (Bigquery SQL) e Programação python; Benefícios: Oferecemos benefícios abrangentes, como Participação nos Resultados, Benefícios Flexíveis (VR, VA, Plano de Saúde e Odontológico), Seguro de Vida, Gympass e Day-off no aniversário. Apoiamos famílias com Auxílio Creche, licença maternidade de 180 dias e licença paternidade de 20 dias. Nossa prioridade é promover o bem-estar, o equilíbrio, o crescimento pessoal e profissional. #BVS

jobs_description: Nós somos a CVC Corp, o maior grupo de viagens das Américas, formado por unidades de negócios que atuam com marcas distintas nos segmentos de viagens de férias e de lazer, viagens corporativas e relacionadas a cursos e intercâmbio cultural no exterior. A evolução, a expertise e o pioneirismo das nossas marcas impactam o mercado, a economia e a vida de milhões de pessoas que buscam realizar seus sonhos, eternizando memórias. Aqui, formamos um time que busca evolução constante, protagonismo e bons motivos para continuar transformando o mundo com o nosso negócio. A nossa bandeira é o respeito. E para fortalecer a nossa diversidade, queremos expandir a pluralidade da nossa gente buscando equidade e valorizando diferentes perspectivas, pautadas nos pilares de Gênero, LGBTI+, Raça, Pessoas com Deficiência e 50+ tornando o nosso ambiente mais diverso e representativo Venha com a gente fazer parte desta transformação! #somoscvccorp Responsabilidades e atribuições Análise de Precificação: Desenvolver e implementar modelos de precificação dinâmicos baseados em análise de dados, custos, concorrência e demanda do mercado. Realizar análises de sensibilidade e cenários para entender impactos de diferentes estratégias de precificação. Realizar análises de take rate, margem, net revenue (receita líquida), e P&L (lucros e perdas), além de outros indicadores financeiros relevantes, para avaliar o impacto das estratégias de precificação sobre a saúde financeira da empresa. Gestão de Dados e BI: Extrair, transformar e carregar dados de diversas fontes para criar um repositório de dados consolidado que suporte análises de precificação. Desenvolver dashboards e relatórios de BI para monitorar indicadores chave de desempenho (KPIs) relacionados a precificação e vendas. Identificar tendências de mercado e insights competitivos através da análise de grandes volumes de dados. Desenvolver e aplicar modelos estatísticos e preditivos para analisar tendências, prever comportamentos de mercado e otimizar estratégias de precificação. Colaboração e Planejamento Estratégico: Trabalhar em colaboração com equipes de produtos, marketing, vendas e planejamento financeiro para desenvolver estratégias de precificação que maximizem a receita e a margem de lucro. Apresentar recomendações baseadas em dados para a equipe de liderança, suportando decisões estratégicas e táticas. Elaborar apresentações estratégicas para a diretoria da empresa, comunicando análises, insights e recomendações de precificação de maneira clara e impactante. Otimização e Inovação: Implementar testes A/B para estratégias de precificação e promover a cultura de experimentação e aprendizado contínuo. Continuamente buscar melhorias nos processos de análise de dados e precificação, adotando novas tecnologias e metodologias quando aplicável. Requisitos e qualificações Cursando ou formação em Economia, Engenharia, Estatística, Matemática, Ciência da Computação ou áreas relacionadas; Dominio em excel (Imprescindível); Boa comunicação e apresentação e entendimento de análises complexas; Capacidade de trabalhar em equipe, colaborando efetivamente com diferentes departamentos. Diferencial: Compreensão de modelos de precificação, raciocínio lógico e análise de mercado. Experiência em análise de dados e BI, como SQL, Python, Knime, Power BI, Databricks e etc. Vivência no segmento de turismo. Informações adicionais PARA O SEU DIA A DIA: Vale Refeição e/ou Alimentação; Vale Transporte; Auxílio Creche e Filho com Deficiência. CUIDAR DA SAÚDE E BEM-ESTAR Assistência Médica com isenção de mensalidade para você e seus dependentes (filhos(as) e cônjuge) (SulAmérica - com coparticipação); Assistência Odontológica (SulAmérica); Seguro de Vida; Convênios Farmácia (Univers); Academia (Total Pass); Programa “Amor de Mãe” – para o cuidado das gestantes, sejam as pessoas colaboradoras ou cônjuges, durante o pré-natal. Empréstimo Consignado; E, ainda, as Licenças Estendidas para maternidade (180 dias), paternidade (20 dias) e adoção (entre 135 a 180 dias, dependendo da idade da criança). CURTIR A VIDA Programa Minha Viagem: descontos na compra de pacotes e passagens aéreas, hospedagem, entre outros produtos, benefício extensível para seus dependentes e ascendentes” Convênio com o SESC; Day Off no mês do seu aniversário; Cinemark: Parceria atrativa com a rede. POTENCIALIZAR O SEU DESENVOLVIMENTO Universidade Corporativa; Parcerias com instituições de Ensino.

titulo: PESSOA ESPECIALISTA DE ARQUITETURA TI - FOCO EM SALESFORCE
jobs_description: Sobre o Bradesco Pensamos em estratégias que sejam capazes de criar oportunidades para a realização das pessoas e para o desenvolvimento sustentável de empresas e sociedade. Ao longo de oito décadas, com pioneirismo e inovação, contribuímos com a democratização do acesso aos serviços bancários no Brasil e fomos além, nos tornamos um dos maiores grupos financeiros da América Latina. Sobre a oportunidade: O Departamento de Arquitetura tem a responsabilidade de direcionar as soluções técnicas que atendam as estratégias organizacionais e requisitos de negócio, usando como base padrões de mercado, princípios de arquitetura e arquiteturas de referência definidas. Como arquiteto(a), será responsável por construir os desenhos de solução envolvendo ambientes complexos e críticos, garantir aderência aos padrões arquiteturais estabelecidos, o melhor uso das tecnologias envolvidas e promover a inovação. Suas atividades com a gente envolvem: Domínio em estilos arquiteturais, padrões de projeto, padrões de integração, soluções baseadas em nuvens públicas/privadas e on-premises; Proposição de desenhos de soluções, com: Arquitetura de aplicação, de integração, de dados e técnica; Captura e tradução de requisitos funcionais em técnicos; Definição de arquiteturas de componentes, front-end modernos, integração e APIs, micro serviços, dados; Projetos de modernização e jornadas para a nuvem; Conhecimento no uso de soluções cloud baseados nos modelos SaaS, PaaS e IaaS; Trabalhar com ao menos um dos principais provedores de nuvem (AZURE, AWS, GCP); Trabalhar com equipes de desenvolvimento e gerentes de produto para idealizar soluções de software; Projetar arquitetura do lado do cliente e do lado do servidor; Criar o front-end de aplicativos por meio de um design visual atraente; Desenvolver e gerenciar bancos de dados e aplicativos; Escrever APIs eficazes; Testar o software para garantir capacidade de resposta e eficiência; Solucionar problemas, depurar e atualizar software; Criar configurações de segurança e proteção de dados. Para essa oportunidade você precisa: Java, NodeJS, SpringBoot, Angular, entre outros; Kafka, RabbitMQ; Mongo, Cassandra, SQL/NoSQL, Redis, Postgree, DB2; Containers, Kubernets; Metodologias Ágeis; Conceito FinOps; Conhecimento em Salesforce; Conhecimento em GitOps. Conhecimentos desejado em: Arquitetura Corporativa: Arquitetura de Negócio, Arquitetura de Aplicação, Arquitetura de Dados/Informações, Arquitetura de Infraestrutura e Segurança. O que nós oferecemos: Remuneração -> Aderente às melhores práticas de mercado PLR (Participação nos Lucros e Resultados) -> Aderente às melhores práticas de mercado* Saúde -> Plano de saúde, odontológico e seguro de vida, além de descontos em farmácias. Auxílios -> Refeição, alimentação e transporte. Previdência –> Plano opcional e exclusivo para funcionários, com participação financeira da Organização Bradesco. Bem-estar -> O programa interno Viva Bem Bradesco conta com diversas iniciativas para prevenção de doenças e promoção de hábitos, atitudes e comportamentos saudáveis, além de oferecer orientação e aconselhamento para resolução de problemas pessoais, familiares, legais e financeiros. Capacitação -> Por meio da Universidade Corporativa Bradesco, a Unibrad, investimos no aprendizado pessoal e profissional do nosso time, promovendo soluções de aprendizagem e parcerias com instituições de ensino. Isenção de tarifas –> Cesta de serviços bancários exclusiva, com descontos e condições especiais em diversos produtos e serviços da Organização Bradesco. Mães, Pais e Filhos -> Auxílio creche/babá, licença paternidade e licença maternidade estendida, além de acompanhamento assistencial da gestação até o pós-parto.

titulo: Administrador de Banco de Dados Pleno
qtd_candidatos: Mais de 100 candidaturas
jobs_description: Trabalhe na Exadel - Quem somos: Desde 1998, a Exadel projeta seus produtos e softwares personalizados para clientes de todos os tamanhos. Com sede em Walnut Creek, Califórnia, a Exadel tem mais de 2.800 funcionários em centros de desenvolvimento na América, Europa e Ásia. As pessoas impulsionam o sucesso da Exadel e estão no centro dos nossos valores. Procuramos um Administrador de Banco de Dados Pleno com experiência em suporte. Resumo: Profissional de TI com no minimo 3+ anos de experiencia em suporte a bancos de dados SQL Server ou Oracle, outros bancos como MySQL, DB2, Postgres, MariaDB, MongoDB, Cassandra, serão um plus. Necessário experiencia de conhecimento dos componentes de arquitetura da base de dados, incluindo a instalação, conhecimento de dados relacionais e nao-relacionais, gestão de acesso a usuários, protegendo dados. Conhecimento de técnicas para melhoria do desempenho da base e objetos de dados, recuperação de desastres e demais atividades da função. O candidato irá trabalhar em uma equipe 24x7, colaborando com as equipes de operações de TI, suporte a aplicativos e/ou como parte da equipe de desenvolvimento. Atuará como interface entre equipes de TI e, ocasionalmente, com o negócio. Responsabilidades: Criar e configurar novas instâncias do banco, incluindo grupos de disponibilidade e clustering de failover Facilitar reuniões de brainstorming para revisar, analisar e avaliar sistemas e necessidades de negócios Responsável pelos métodos de backup e recuperação de banco de dados, segurança e integridade de acesso ao banco de dados, design de armazenamento físico de dados e administração de armazenamento de dados Auxilia na seleção de um sistema de gerenciamento de banco de dados e na manutenção do desempenho do banco de dados Participe da melhoria contínua dos processos Baixar e instale service packs e atualizações da base de dados. Configurar e manter controles de segurança SQL Fazer recomendações para a arquitetura do sistema conforme as práticas recomendadas da plataforma para qual atua. Gerenciar backup e recuperação de banco de dados, bem como planejamento de recuperação de desastres, em coordenação com o time de gestão Criar, alterar e melhorar tarefas e planos de manutenção da base dados Monitorar proativamente as tarefas de manutenção da base de dados, solucionando problemas de processos com falha e resolução de problemas o mais rápido possível. Analisar e solucionar os problemas de lentidão e baixo desempenho da base de dados Responsável por análise e ajustes de consultas SQL. Responsável pelas migrações de banco de dados e atualizações de servidores. Requisitos: Bacharel em ciência da computação ou disciplina relacionada Amplo conhecimento em ferramentas de SQL Experiência em Desempenho, Desenvolvimento e Manutenção de Banco de Dados Compreensão aprofundada dos requisitos de segurança de banco de dados, backup e recuperação e monitoramento de desempenho. Familiaridade com modelagem de dados relacionais e dimensionais Amplo conhecimento em design, implementação e conversão de banco de dados Experiência com SSAS, SSIS e SSRS. Desejável: Certificações de mercado para bases de dados Oracle e SQL Server Conhecimento prático em infraestruturas Linux e Windows Server Conhecimentos em scripting como shell, PowerShell, e Unix Amplo conhecimento em tecnologias de banco de dados (MySQL, MS SQL, PostgreSQL Oracle, MongoDB). Experiência com serviços em nuvem (Requerido AWS, Desejável Azure). Documentar atividades rotineiras de administração de banco de dados. Apoiar atividades do ETL de big data na plataforma que atua, bem como pela criação e modificação de relatórios de administração da base dados. Integrar a base de dados com aplicativos corporativos. Desenvolver statements SQL (T-SQL/PL-SQL) para atender as atividades de administração de banco de dados. Benefícios/Vantagens: Vantagens de trabalhar com Exadel: Roteiro de carreira transparente. O gestor de RH acompanha cada colaborador em seus primeiros passos na empresa e os auxilia no alcance de objetivos profissionais futuros. A Exadel é uma empresa global com mais de 30 escritórios em mais de 15 países. Os funcionários podem descobrir novos lugares para morar e trabalhar e transferir-se para qualquer local com um escritório de produção Exadel. O gestor de RH e o especialista em Mobilidade Global acompanham o colaborador e auxiliam em todo o processo de realocação. O crescimento da sua carreira está em suas mãos, então cada Exadeller decide quando subir de nível e iniciar avaliações de desempenho. A equipe de gestão apoia o planejamento de carreira e a descoberta de novas tecnologias e linguagens. Oportunidades de aprendizagem e desenvolvimento. Inclui certificações, sessões de treinamento, encontros, conferências e materiais educacionais. Os funcionários participam ativamente e se beneficiam do ambiente de compartilhamento de conhecimento em sete unidades práticas: Tecnologias de Marketing Digital, Marketing de Conteúdo, IA, QA, QAA, Agile e DevOps. Os funcionários podem encontrar gravações de encontros e treinamentos no Sistema Interno de aprendizagem da Exadel. Equilíbrio entre trabalho e vida pessoal. Cada Exadeller é responsável por gerenciar seu fluxo de trabalho de forma independente, sem ser microgerenciado em cada etapa; é, no entanto, importante que um funcionário sempre compareça às reuniões, registre seu tempo e cumpra os prazos. Operar no escritório ou remotamente depende da modalidade de preferência do funcionário. Os funcionários em modo híbrido ou remoto receberão os equipamentos necessários antes do primeiro dia de trabalho. Para quem prefere trabalhar no escritório, a rede de escritórios oferece equipamentos de última geração, boas instalações e um ambiente colaborativo acolhedor. A equipe se reúne em dois eventos anuais de formação de equipes em vários locais; além disso, há eventos de equipe como Pizza Days, Programmer’s Day, encontros informais, festas de jogos de tabuleiro e iniciativas esportivas. Vantagens e benefícios para funcionários: O programa de indicação Exadel abrange todas as regiões e envolve o reconhecimento dos profissionais recomendados contratados. Dependendo da localização e do cargo, um funcionário que indicou recebe um bônus após o período de experiência do indicado. Voluntários para orientação, entrevistas, realização de avaliações e participação em encontros comunitários recebem bônus monetários adicionais. Exadellers podem acessar benefícios como reembolso de seguro médico, plano de saúde e dental (Bradesco,sem co-participação ou desconto para o funcionário), VA / VR e auxílio babá.

jobs_description: If you have fallen and risen, if you have broken and fixed, if you have dreamt and built, then you have grit. Then we speak the same language. Welcome to the Wolfpack. About CloudWalk: We are one of the fastest growing fintechs on the planet. We kick ass. A unicorn, with millions of happy customers, a hardcore team, and hundreds of millions in funding and revenue. But not your typical startup. We build and learn, fast, and we want the hackers, the artists, the crafters - join the Wolfpack! This opportunity is aimed at professionals who identify as people with disabilities (PWD), and we currently have 1 position available. What You'll Be Doing: Reviewing and analyzing chargeback claims, identifying fraudulent transactions, and taking appropriate actions to mitigate losses; Investigating and documenting chargeback disputes, gathering relevant evidence, and preparing responses; Collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand transaction data and identify fraud patterns or trends; Recommending and implementing strategies to reduce chargeback rates and prevent fraudulent activities; Maintaining accurate records and documentation related to chargeback cases; Monitoring chargeback-related KPIs and performance metrics to ensure effective chargeback management; Staying up-to-date with industry trends, regulations, and best practices related to chargebacks and fraud prevention. What You Need To Succeed: Strong analytical skills and attention to detail to effectively investigate and resolve chargeback cases; Ability to work independently and as part of a team to handle complex chargeback issues; Knowledge of chargeback processes and regulations is a plus, but not mandatory; Familiarity with SQL, Python, or Ruby would be advantageous but is not a strict requirement; Previous experience in chargeback management or fraud prevention is a valuable asset; Excellent communication skills in English; Strong problem-solving skills to identify root causes and implement preventive measures; Fast learning capabilities to adapt to evolving chargeback trends and technologies. We are not expecting candidates to have expertise across all of these areas. We will gladly help you bridge the gaps. As a member of a fully remote and distributed team, you are expected to complete tasks autonomously, being highly collaborative and self-driven. Diversity and Inclusion We believe in social inclusion, respect, and appreciation of all people. We promote a welcoming work environment, where each CloudWalker can be authentic, regardless of gender, ethnicity, race, religion, sexuality, mobility, disability, or education.

jobs_description: Location : BAL - SEDE City : Sao Paulo State : São Paulo (BR-SP) Country : Brazil (BR) Requisition Number : 33500 Bunge has an exciting opportunity available for "Analista de Business Intelligence Senior". In this role you will be part of a global team working on challenging, meaningful projects impacting core business activities. Since 1818, Bunge has been connecting farmers to consumers to deliver essential food, feed, and fuel to the world. Looking to the future, our ambition is to continuously reinvent ourselves, leveraging data to be at the forefront of analytics, technology and talent to accomplish our purpose in a better, faster and simpler way. Bunge is committed to operating and thriving in the digital world – creating world class agile teams where teammates are empowered and encouraged to collaborate and test and learn to succeed. At Bunge, people don’t just come here to work, they come here to grow – solving challenges that directly impact the world with a diverse team of thinkers and doers. Bunge offers a strong compensation and benefits package, generous paid time off program, flexible work arrangements, and opportunity to progress. Our hybrid work environment provides a balance of in-office and remote work. Most importantly, in all we do we live our values: Act as One Team by fostering inclusion, collaboration, and respect Drive for Excellence by being agile, innovative and efficient Do What's Right by acting safely, ethically, and sustainably Overview: You will be responsible for conducting basic research, data mining, data governance, reporting and interpretation of company performance metrics. Additional job responsibilities include direct support to the senior account executive related to team performance management, operations strategy, and communications. This job is part of the Business Intelligence team within the Data & Analytics CoE. They are responsible for reviewing data that supports improving effectiveness and predicting outcomes to develop business intelligence. Essential Functions: Generate reports using data from multiple sources to assist in creating a complete evaluation, improvement, or recommendation. Review the accuracy of information provided and respond to requests from management and vendors. Understand and work with scenario planning tools and models. Investigate current trends in general business conditions. Identify performance and process improvement opportunities. Assist with the coordination involving personnel from other departments and information technology groups to facilitate successful project implementations. Manage the maintenance and reporting of benchmarks and performance metrics. Has broad business knowledge for assigned business teams (i.e. freight, supply chain, agri business, accounting) Adapts plans within the department Recommends solutions/best practices based upon understanding of business units to help refine & improve what is being requested by the Business Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) (Measurable outcomes that the position contributes to): Participates in small to medium projects of moderate complexity; Contributes to process improvements. As part of an Agile team, responsible for the execution of main activities to obtain important results through collaboration with others on the Agile team. Performs a variety of complex tasks; Uses best practices and knowledge of internal or external business issues to improve products/services or processes. Problems may require analysis to understand. Solves difficult, non-routine problems but are not complex Requires taking a new perspective on existing solutions Requirements: Bachelor's degree with 3 - 5 years of position related experience, or equivalent combo of education and experience level. Preferred experience in Agri business or related business area Ability to use existing procedures to solve standard problems. Experience with analyzing information and standard practices to make judgments. In-depth knowledge of Microsoft Office products. Examples include Word, Excel, Outlook, etc. Must have solid understanding of Agile methodologies & collaborate within an Scrum / Agile team Basic knowledge of analytics or relational database system, such as Oracle, BigQuery, PostgreSQL, Microsoft SQL Server, or MySQL Possess strong technical skills in BI technologies such as Tableau, Looker, and PowerBI; need ablility to learn these skills quickly Bunge (NYSE: BG) is a world leader in sourcing, processing and supplying oilseed and grain products and ingredients. Founded in 1818, Bunge’s expansive network feeds and fuels a growing world, creating sustainable products and opportunities for more than 70,000 farmers and the consumers they serve across the globe. The company is headquartered in St. Louis, Missouri and has 25,000 employees worldwide who stand behind more than 350 port terminals, oilseed processing plants, grain facilities, and food and ingredient production and packaging facilities around the world. Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. jobs_description: Company Description At Turner & Townsend we’re passionate about making the difference. That means delivering better outcomes for our clients, helping our people to realize their potential, and doing our part to create a prosperous society. Every day we help our major global clients deliver ambitious and highly technical projects in over 118 offices in 50 countries worldwide. Our team is dynamic, innovative and client focused. Our clients value our proactive approach, depth of expertise, integrity and the quality we deliver. As a result, our people get to work on some of the most exciting projects in the world. Job Description The Cost/Estimator will take responsibility for effectively delivering a range of tasks to high quality standard and aid on a wide range of projects of all sizes and dimensions. The professional will report to a Cost Manager and will be responsible for commercial aspects of projects in several sectors, supporting with budget management, project cost control, estimation, procurement, and change control during execution. Qualifications Responsibilities Included But Not Limited To Support estimations according to all design phases. Monitor and control Valuations. Participate on value engineering sessions. Prepare and analyze change orders. Develop progress measurement criteria with vendors. Collect cost market data. Support quotation process responding to the questions of services/materials proponents. Produce cash flow forecasts for internal and client purposes. Quantify materials and labor for all phases of a project. Support on reviewing project budget after design packages issuance by the technical team. Collaborate with the creation of the recommendation report. Participate in the weekly project and departmental meetings. Issue weekly progress reports on project costs including forecasting reimbursable expenses. Support on stakeholder management. Requirements Degree-qualified or equivalent in Quantity Surveyor, Engineering, Architecture. A minimum of 7 years’ related experience. Complete project ownership. Knowledge in Oil & Gas industry is desirable. Knowledge and understanding of the component parts of a project and overall construction costs. Excellent communication skills, both oral & written Negotiation skills and ability to apply those skills internally, externally & with our supply chain. jobs_description: MUST APPLY IN ENGLISH We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Data Platform Architect to join our dynamic and growing data platform team. As a Data Platform Architect, you will play a crucial role in strengthening and expanding the core of our data products. Your responsibilities will include scaling our business, supporting data-driven decisions, and contributing to our overall data strategy. You will work alongside talented data platform engineers to envision how all the data elements from multiple sources should fit together and then execute that plan. The ideal candidate must: Effectively communicate complex data problems by tailoring the message to the audience and presenting it clearly and concisely. Balance multiple perspectives, disagree, and commit when necessary to move key company decisions and critical priorities forward. Have a profound comprehension of data quality, governance, and analytics. Ability to work independently in a dynamic environment and proactively approach problem-solving. Is committed to driving positive business outcomes through expert data handling and analysis. Be an example for fellow engineers by showcasing customer empathy, creativity, curiosity, and tenacity. Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to innovate and adapt to fast-paced environments. Design and build clear, understandable, simple, clean, and scalable solutions. Responsibilities: Architect, strengthening, and expanding the core data products to scale our business, integrating data from multiple sources into a cohesive structure. Take full ownership of significant portions of our data products, including collaborating with stakeholders on the data model, designing large-scale data processing solutions, and ensuring the delivery of high-quality data on time. Work alongside Analytics Engineers, Data Scientists, and Software Engineers to develop intuitive data products for analysis, machine learning, and reporting. Manage data warehousing solutions, develop scalable data processing solutions, and ensure adherence to data governance policies. Design scalable and reliable data pipelines to integrate and analyze large volumes of data from diverse sources, supporting our business's growing needs. Collaborate across teams to define our data roadmap, working alongside data scientists, machine learning engineers, and product and business leaders to identify and prioritize key data initiatives. Building and maintaining frameworks to measure and monitor data quality and integrity, ensuring our data assets remain accurate and reliable. Architect, deploy, and optimize Databricks solutions on AWS, developing scalable data processing solutions, implementing CI/CD processes for these solutions, and leveraging infrastructure-as-code tooling to streamline data operations and enhance data solution deployments. Implement data solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Spark, Python, Databricks, and various AWS services (S3, Redshift, EMR, Athena, Glue). Mentor and coach fellow engineers on the team, fostering an environment of growth and continuous improvement. Identify and address gaps in team capabilities and processes to enhance team efficiency and success. Apply statistical analytical techniques to tackle complex data challenges, innovate with new technologies and methods to solve business problems, and work on diverse, geographically distributed project teams. Requirements for position : Ideally has over 10 years of experience in data engineering, including at least 5 years of experience as a data architect and extensive expertise in designing and leading complex data warehousing, data modeling, and data transformation projects for both batch and streaming systems. Have successfully navigated the challenges of working with large-scale data systems. Deep understanding of data processing, comfortable working with multi-terabyte datasets, and skilled in high-scale data ingestion, transformation, and distributed processing, with strong Apache Spark (Scala or Python) capabilities. Hands-on experience with command programming languages such as Python, Scala, or Java, as well as data exploration using SQL Hands-on expertise in data technologies with proficiency in technologies such as Spark, Airflow, Databricks, AWS services (SQS, Kinesis, etc.), and Kafka. Understand the trade-offs of various architectural approaches and recommend solutions suited to our needs. Experience with the latest technologies and trends in Data and Cloud platforms. Database and analytics expertise, familiarity with a broad range of databases and analytics technologies (data warehousing, data lakes, ETL, relational databases), and ability to navigate the landscape to deliver effective data solutions. Leadership and mentorship demonstrate the ability to mentor engineers, fostering their growth and development, and you have successfully partnered with product and machine learning teams on strategic data initiatives. Commitment to quality, you take pride in delivering work that excels in data accuracy, performance, and reliability, setting a high standard for the team and the organization. We want to provide an inclusive interview experience for all, including people with disabilities. We are happy to provide reasonable accommodations to candidates in need of individualized support during the hiring process. Signifyd's Applicant Privacy Notice

jobs_description: About Credix Credix is a FinTech company offering a Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) solution tailored for business-to-business (B2B) transactions in Brazil. Our platform empowers businesses to streamline their purchasing processes, improve cash flow management, and foster strong supplier relationships. As we expand in the Brazilian market, we seek a dynamic and experienced Machine Learning Engineer to join our Risk&Data team. Why choose Credix? Become part of a forward-thinking start-up where boldness and a commitment to excellence are paramount, and your personal and professional development is at the forefront. Work alongside a dedicated team of bright individuals driven by an Olympian mindset to excel in every aspect of our operations. Together, we aim to build with velocity, utilizing innovative embedded finance strategies to expand business operations in Latin America. Experience a close and supportive work atmosphere where collaboration thrives, wise judgment guides our decisions, and where you have the opportunity to learn, grow, and take on meaningful responsibilities. About the job As we scale our presence in the Brazilian market, we are seeking an experienced Machine Learning Engineer. This person will be crucial in advancing our risk and fraud detection capabilities by developing, implementing, and deploying cutting-edge machine learning models. The ideal candidate will master both the theoretical aspects of machine learning and the practical engineering challenges, with a strong inclination towards rapid prototyping, testing, and iteration of data-driven solutions. Qualifications +5 years of experience as a data scientist and machine learning engineer Fluent in English and Portuguese (written and verbal) Strong background in developing, deploying, and monitoring machine learning models in production environments Proven track record of applying machine learning models to assess credit risk and combat fraud in Brazil, focused on SMEs and ideally in the context of trade finance Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools (e.g., Apache Airflow) Knowledge of cloud computing platforms (Google Cloud Platform) and their machine learning services Familiarity with data storage and processing technologies (e.g., SQL, NoSQL, Hadoop, Spark) Ability to work in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment, adapting to changing priorities and managing multiple projects simultaneously. Analytical mindset, combined with outstanding interpersonal and communication skills Responsibilities Design, implement, and deploy machine learning models to detect fraud and assess risk in real-time Develop scalable data pipelines to ingest, clean, and process diverse datasets from various sources Collaborate with the product and engineering teams to integrate machine learning models into the core product Monitor and maintain the performance of machine learning models in production, making adjustments as necessary to ensure optimal operation Conduct experiments, perform back tests and prototype new models to improve CrediPay's risk and fraud detection capabilities continuously Unblock critical paths in the core product to enhance overall velocity and efficiency Stay up to speed with the latest advancements in machine learning and data engineering, incorporating new technologies and methodologies to drive innovation Join our dynamic and ambitious team: With access to our offices in Sao Paulo or Antwerp, you'll immerse yourself in a culture of innovation and collaboration. But that's just the beginning - here's what else we offer: A culture of learning and experimentation: where you are encouraged to explore new ideas and technologies Competitive salary package : Your hard work deserves recognition, and we ensure you're well-rewarded for your contributions. Equity stock options plan : Be a part of our journey towards success and share in the rewards. Paid holidays : Enjoy the flexibility to recharge and rejuvenate Bi-annual off-sites : Awesome team building, unforgettable memories, and adventures ensured during our team off-sites. Please submit your application along with an English version of your resume.

titulo: Analista de Inteligência de Mercado Pleno
qtd_candidatos: Mais de 100 candidaturas
jobs_description: Quer fazer parte da nossa rede de prosperidade? Vem pra Serena! Na Serena, o nosso ativo mais valioso são as pessoas. Aqui, reunimos as melhores mentes e corações apaixonados por nossa missão de tornar a energia sustentável uma realidade para todos. Nosso ambiente é dinâmico, ágil e respondemos rapidamente e de forma ousada a desafios. Inovação e coragem nos movem a encontrar novas maneiras para que clientes, acionistas, fornecedores, coempreendedores e comunidades possam alcançar a prosperidade por meio da energia limpa e sustentável. Como Analista de Inteligência de Mercado Pleno , você será responsável por: Apoiar análises de inteligência de mercado e de negócios no Brasil e nos Estados Unidos fundamentado em dados e fatos, através da colaboração com áreas clientes; Criar e concretizar soluções setoriais e estratégias de negócio, baseadas em fatos e dados, para otimizar e gerar novas oportunidades de negócio para a Serena; Coletar, analisar e interpretar dados complexos para aplicações na inteligência de mercado e negócio; Automatizar cálculos tarifários e de planejamento elétrico recorrentes; Criar e automatizar relatórios de inteligência de mercado e negócio em busca de trazer insights. Para conectar sua energia com a nossa, é essencial: Superior completo em áreas das ciências exatas (Engenharia, Ciência de Dados, Economia, Estatística e áreas correlatas); Experiência com geração de inteligência a partir de dados; Conhecimento avançados em softwares e programação para aplicações na análise de dados (Phyton, VBA, etc); Leitura técnica em inglês; Perfil analítico com desenvoltura e interesse em trabalhar com alto volume de dados e automações. Desejável Inglês avançado; Experiência no setor elétrico. Nossos benefícios de alimentação/refeição flexível (Caju) sem desconto em folha; Variável Anual (PPR); Online de Educação e Desenvolvimento (Edupass); Transporte (posições presenciais); Home Office (posições remotas); de Reconhecimento Interno. Para que nossos coemprededores coloquem sua saúde em primeiro lugar: de Saúde e Odontológico Sulamérica sem coparticipação; com a Vittude - Plataforma de auxílio à Saúde Emocional (4 sessões de terapia por mês custeadas pela Serena); frescas todos os dias no escritório e nos clusters; Ergonomia (posições remotas); de Mindfulness semanais; ao Esporte; de Vida. Localização da vaga São Paulo - SP. Regime presencial (com home office 1x na semana). Nosso processo seletivo Acreditamos que a melhor forma de conhecer uma companhia é por meio das pessoas. Por isso, durante o nosso processo seletivo você terá a oportunidade de conversar com pessoas de diferentes times da Serena, que poderão formar a sua rede no futuro aqui com a gente. Aproveite esse momento para nos contar mais sobre você, conhecer um pouco mais sobre suas principais habilidades (sim! Durante o processo oferecemos um diagnóstico de autoconhecimento e um manual para você se preparar para as entrevistas 😉) e descobrir ainda mais sobre nós! Nossa cultura Nossos princípios guiam a nossa cultura. Por isso, queremos pessoas que tenham um desejo muito forte de fazer parte da nossa jornada rumo a uma nova era energética. Queremos corações que pulsem com a nossa missão de mudar o mercado de energia, mentes que se conectem com a nossa energia e liberem todo o seu potencial e vozes que ecoem o nosso propósito e se tornem parte de nosso ciclo de prosperidade! Se a sua energia for igual à nossa, então #VemPraSerena!

Se você possui os requisitos abaixo, essa oportunidade pode ser sua: Formação em Direito, Administração, Economia, Ciência da Computação, Análise de Dados; Conhecimento em ciência de Dados; Experiência em Seguradoras ou mercado financeiro; Conhecimento em fraudes em Seguros; Conhecimento em PLDFT. titulo: Pessoa Coordenadora de Ciência de Dados
jobs_description: Job Description Como Coordenador de Ciência de Dados, você desempenhará um papel de direcionamento técnico e estratégico aos cientistas de dados dentro de equipes multifuncionais, auxiliando no planejamento de projetos e apoio hands-on utilizando técnicas avançadas de análise de dados e aprendizado de máquina. Responsibilities and assignments Liderança técnica de equipes de ciência de dados e colaboração com outras áreas de negócios para identificar oportunidades; Auxiliar no planejamento de projetos e na definição de métricas de aprendizado de máquina para garantir a saúde dos produtos; Desenvolver e implementar soluções de ciências de dados sofisticadas para problemas de negócio complexos; Manter-se atualizado sobre os últimos avanços em técnicas de ciências de dados; Fornecer mentoria técnica para os membros de sua equipe. Requirements And Qualifications Ensino Superior em Ciência da Computação, Engenharia, Matemática, Estatística ou área relacionada; Experiência com os principais tipos de modelagem de dados como Clusterização, Regressão e Classificação, assim como as métricas para avaliar seus resultados; Proficiência em análise de dados, modelagem estatística e visualização de dados; Conhecimento em Python, Spark e SQL; Excelente habilidade de comunicação, sendo capaz de transmitir conceitos técnicos para stakeholders não técnicos. Diferencial Pós-graduação na área de Aprendizado de Máquina e Ciência de Dados; Conhecimento em processamento de imagens e Deep Learning; Conhecimento em Processamento de Linguagem Natural; Conhecimento em Tensorflow, PyTorch; Conhecimento em DataBricks, MLFlow, Azure. Additional information O prazo de inscrições para os candidatos internos até 08/03/2024. Localidade: Porto Alegre/RS ou São Paulo/SP. Modalidade: Híbrida Somos ágil. Somos digital. Somos data. Somos tech. A tecnologia nos encanta! 🚀 Aqui, olhamos para o futuro colocando as pessoas em primeiro lugar. Respiramos inovação para cumprir e reforçar nosso encantamento. O tech transforma a experiência de compra, os processos operacionais e o modelo de negócio, trazendo mais receitas e eficiência operacional. E assim surgiu o Encantech, uma comunidade formada pelas áreas Ágil, Digital, Data e Tech da Lojas Renner S.A., com o objetivo de engajar os melhores talentos, gerando experiências incríveis para os nossos clientes. Você busca uma trabalhar em uma empresa que prioriza a cultura orientada por dados para obter resultados extraordinários? Se o que te encanta é o respeito, a diversidade e a inclusão. A transformação digital do universo da moda está aqui e nós contamos com você! ❤️ Junte-se ao time de 24 mil colaboradores que estão reunidos para encantar ao lado das marcas Camicado, Renner, Youcom, Ashua Curve & Plus Size, Repassa e Realize. E aí, vem fazer moda responsável com MUITA tecnologia com a gente? 😍 #OQueTeEncantaNosEncanta #VemSerEncantech

jobs_description: Location : BAL - SEDE City : Sao Paulo State : São Paulo (BR-SP) Country : Brazil (BR) Requisition Number : 33499 Bunge has an exciting opportunity available for "Cientista de Dados II". In this role you will be part of a global team working on challenging, meaningful projects impacting core business activities. Since 1818, Bunge has been connecting farmers to consumers to deliver essential food, feed, and fuel to the world. Looking to the future, our ambition is to continuously reinvent ourselves, leveraging data to be at the forefront of analytics, technology and talent to accomplish our purpose in a better, faster and simpler way. Bunge is committed to operating and thriving in the digital world – creating world class agile teams where teammates are empowered and encouraged to collaborate and test and learn to succeed. At Bunge, people don’t just come here to work, they come here to grow – solving challenges that directly impact the world with a diverse team of thinkers and doers. Bunge offers a strong compensation and benefits package, generous paid time off program, flexible work arrangements, and opportunity to progress. Our hybrid work environment provides a balance of in-office and remote work. Most importantly, in all we do we live our values: Act as One Team by fostering inclusion, collaboration, and respect Drive for Excellence by being agile, innovative and efficient Do What's Right by acting safely, ethically, and sustainably Overview: We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced as "Cientista de Dados II" with strong expertise optimization in supply chain to join our growing team. As Senior Data Scientist, you will be responsible for driving the construction of optimization models to solve business problems and communicate to the technical team and assure the delivery matches business expectations. You will also be responsible for working with cross-functional teams to identify and prioritize data analytics initiatives. Essential Functions: Design, create, test and implement complex models and algorithms that drive analytical solutions throughout the organization. Gives technical support for data scientists across multiple squads. Collaborate with business analyst and understand business problems to implement scalable and sustainable solutions. Define development standards and solution approach. Design and structure reusable codebase Coordinate with MIS, Digital Specialists, and Data Engineers to deliver holistic analytical solutions Communicates the design, functioning and output of the analytical models/solutions developed Ensure timely analysis and testing for regular maintenance of solutions over time Communicate data insights to stakeholders. Develops plans within the Supply chain. Is recognized as an expert in own area within the organization. Requirements: Degree in STEM field with 3-5 years experience as Lead Data Scientist Expert in programming languages like Python or R Advanced knowledge in math, analytics and computer science, knowledge of machine learning methods, statistical models, advanced data science programming. Avoid greenhorn mistakes, avoid logical flaws in the models, revisits high-performing systems, write reusable code, builds resilient data pipelines in the cloud environment, and prepares immaculate data. Capable of mentoring Associates and other Data scientists and answer business questions to higher authorities and management. Model behavior as a great team player and teach new ideas. Communications with the project stakeholders on a regular basis Proficient in data science, optimization, machine learning, Python, R, SQL, data analysis, analytical skills, teamwork, and communication skills. Can help business structure the problems/hypotheses they want to address and convert it into a advanced analytics approach including machine learning and optimization components (e.g. Constraints, penalties and objective function Develop business awareness of possible use cases and help them to understand the necessary concepts of data science and optimization to ensure better communication across functions. Bunge (NYSE: BG) is a world leader in sourcing, processing and supplying oilseed and grain products and ingredients. Founded in 1818, Bunge’s expansive network feeds and fuels a growing world, creating sustainable products and opportunities for more than 70,000 farmers and the consumers they serve across the globe. The company is headquartered in St. Louis, Missouri and has 25,000 employees worldwide who stand behind more than 350 port terminals, oilseed processing plants, grain facilities, and food and ingredient production and packaging facilities around the world. Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship, age, disability or military or veteran status, or any other legally protected status. Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled

jobs_description: Job Description: Um pouco sobre a Trouw Líder global em nutrição animal, a Trouw Nutrition é especializada no desenvolvimento de tecnologias de alimentação inovadoras, premixes e soluções de software exclusivas. Qualidade, inovação e sustentabilidade são os nossos princípios orientadores - desde a pesquisa até produtos, modelos e serviços de ponta. Tudo projetado para otimizar a nutrição animal. Quais são os desafios do Coordenador de Business Intelligence Latam? Com reporte ao Gerente de Business Service, o Coordenador de Business Intelligence LATAM desempenha um papel fundamental ao liderar e coordenar uma equipe de profissionais qualificados, combinando expertise técnica em análise de dados com uma compreensão aguçada do mercado e insights empresariais. É também responsável por impulsionar decisões orientadas por dados, utilizando ferramentas avançadas e capitalizando a inteligência de negócios para fornecer insights à equipe de liderança nível Latam. Esta posição exige uma habilidade única de conseguir combinar conhecimentos técnicos e com uma visão estratégica para otimizar os processos decisórios e impulsionar o sucesso organizacional. Atribuições: Colaborar com as partes interessadas para entender as demandas de negócio e supervisionar o desenvolvimento de relatórios e dashboards eficazes que atendam às necessidades de áreas estratégicas. Liderar e coordenar a equipe de BI. Oferecer orientação, mentoria e apoio aos membros da equipe para garantir a execução bem-sucedida de projetos. Trabalhar em estreita colaboração com líderes de negócios para compreender metas e objetivos organizacionais. Traduzir requisitos empresariais em soluções de dados. Análise e Interpretação: Realizar análises críticas dos dados para identificar tendências, padrões e insights. Apoiar na tomada de decisões estratégicas com base no resultado destas análises. Colaborar com diversas áreas tais como: Vendas, Marketing, Finanças e Operações para identificar oportunidades de melhorias e eficiências orientadas por dados. Possuir um background técnico em ferramentas e habilidades como Power BI, SQL, Data Warehousing e processos ETL. Supervisionar o desenvolvimento e a manutenção de pipelines de dados, modelos de dados e painéis para garantir precisão e acessibilidade dos dados. Estabelecer e manter políticas e procedimentos de governança de dados para garantir a qualidade, a consistência e a segurança deles. Assegurar conformidade com regulamentações de privacidade de dados (LGPD). Requisitos Formação Acadêmica: Ensino Superior Completo em Ciência da Computação, Ciência de Dados ou áreas afins. Idiomas: Inglês avançado (mandatório), espanhol intermediário (desejável). Tempo de Experiência: Sólido background em inteligência de negócios, análise de dados ou uma função relacionada, além de possuir no mínimo 3 anos de experiência em gestão de pessoas. (mandatório) Ferramentas: Proficiência em habilidades técnicas como Power BI, SQL, Azure, Data Warehouse e processos ETL. Localidade: Campinas- SP. Modalidade: Atuação Híbrida no Office de Campinas, com disponibilidade para eventuais viagens em todo território nacional. Perfil Fortes habilidades de compreensão de negócios e capacidade de traduzir dados em insights acionáveis. Desenvolvimento Capacidade de propor soluções concretas Liderança Comunicação Realização A Trouw Nutrition Brasil acredita e apoia a diversidade e a inclusão. Estamos comprometidos em promover um ambiente de trabalho diversificado e inclusivo. Assim, em nossos processos seletivos, todas as candidaturas são bem-vindas independentemente de gênero, idade, origem étnica, condição social ou econômica, orientação sexual, identidade ou expressão de gênero, condição física ou de saúde, religião, afiliação, ou qualquer outra diferença ou condição. Todos os candidatos terão paridade de participação sem quaisquer discriminações. Our organisation: Trouw Nutrition is the global leader in innovative feed specialties, premixes and nutritional services for the animal nutrition industry. Trouw Nutrition provides species-specific nutritional solutions consisting of feed concepts, products and nutritional know-how. The unique combination of products, models and services Trouw Nutrition offers, boosts productivity and supports animal health through all life stages, contributing to our customers' peace of mind. Trouw Nutrition's nutrition solutions have met the need of farmers and home-mixers, feed producers, integrators and distributors. Trouw Nutrition has locations in 25 countries and around 5000 employees. Our mission is Feeding the Future. Equal Opportunity Employer: Trouw Nutrition is an equal opportunity employer; applicants are considered for all roles without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex, national origin, citizenship status, age, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, marital, parental, military status or any other status protected by applicable local law. Please advise us at any point during the recruitment and selection process if you require accommodation. Trouw Nutrition is committed to compliance with all applicable legislation, including providing accommodation for applicants with disabilities.

About The Role We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our Payments Data Science and Analytics team and make significant contributions to our mission to streamline and optimize Uber's global payment experiences. You will work with product managers, engineers and fellow data scientists to shape the direction of one or more products within Payments. You will work on fast-moving, high-stakes problems reaching a global audience. A deep analytical passion and the ability to execute on key business priorities is a must for this role. Note about the role: If you are interested in advanced modeling and putting models into production, this role is not it! We have an Applied Science team which works on these types of projects. ---- What the Candidate Will Do ---- Analyze key data assets to understand our payment experiences. Develop and monitor strategic metrics and understand all underlying drivers. Design and run experiments to analyze the impact of product changes. Deep dive into data to evaluate proposed product changes and identify opportunities for improving the user experience. Collaborate with product managers and other business leaders to make decisions based on data insights and experiment results. Communicate your findings to cross functional peers and management. ---- Basic Qualifications ---- Bachelors or M.S. with a degree in Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or other quantitative fields. 2yrs+ experience in improving products, understanding the user journey and extracting insights from data. Advanced SQL expertise 2yrs+ experience launching multiple experiments (such as A/B experiments) and an understanding of experimental design and using statistical methods in exploratory analysis Experience with dashboarding/data visualization (i.e. Google Data Studio, Tableau, Mixpanel, Looker or similar). Ability to work in a self-guided manner Superb communication and organization skills ---- Bonus ---- Experience using Python or R. Data engineering/pipeline creation experience. Prior experience within the payments industry. Ability to deliver on tight timelines and prioritize tasks while maintaining quality and detail
